name: elevador.lacerda #2
description:
#14 - streets of salvador

"elevador lacerda" is a public transportation system in the city of Salvador, capital of the brazilian state of bahia. It is the first urban elevator in the world. on december 8, 1873, when the first tower was inaugurated, it was the world's tallest elevator, at 63 meters (300 feet). 

the dynamics of salvador the first capital of brazil, its architectural structures and miscegenated people are portrayed in photos and videos from the perspective of those who were raised there.

the blackest city outside africa, salvador is the portrait of all the inequality generated by a slave colony.

salvador - bahia - brazil - 2015
